Author: PartyTimeSexyDisco
Text: I have an extended (3 month) hospital stay that put a gap in my resume that I get asked about relatively often and I always say it was prolonged medical issues that are now thankfully resolved. Which is kind of an official sounding way of putting it but it works and it's not legal for interviewers to pry anyway. Not really the same situation as youre in but I think most people get the hit that it might be something touchy you'd rather not dwell on it or talk about if you just say something along the lines of 'medical issues, I'll be gone a while but hopefully I'll be fixed right up and back good as new :)' you feel?

Author: fac_ade
Text: I cant really help with the whole talking to your dietitian thing but what I'll tell you is what someone else told me here, that you're never gonna feel "sick enough" or truly *thin enough* (I'd say most of us here seem to have that mindset) for anything be it in your head when you reach a GW or when you consider treatment. It's not a contest over there to see who's the worst one off out of the rest, you're going there to heal right? And secondly for the coworker? It depends if you're super close and trust them then disclosing the truth is an option, if not so much then a simple and vague lie like family troubles or something would work, believable yet don't go too much into detail or it'll spiral out lol
